org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables

Annotation Type Input


  • @Repeatable
 @Target
 @Retention
public Input

    Methods or fields annotated with this annotation will be treated as test inputs of a annotationclass DecisionTableFixture.

    The input value will be taken from the column matching one of the org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables.Input$value() mappings. All inputs will be set before any annotationclass Check annotated method is invoked.

    If a field is annotated and it is of one of the natively supported types, it will be set using one of LivingDoc's implementations. If you want to use your own, or the type is not natively supported, you wil have to configure a interface TypeConverter either directly on the field or on the fixture class using the annotationclass Converter annotation.

    If a method is annotated it has to have exactly one parameter! As with fields, custom interface TypeConverter might have to be configured.

    The annotation can have multiple org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables.Input$value(). One usecase for this might be having multiple languages for your documentation or having changed the column name between versions of your documentation you still want to maintain.

    See Also:
    annotationclass DecisionTableFixture, org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables.Input$value(), annotationclass Check, interface TypeConverter, annotationclass Converter, interface TypeConverter, org.livingdoc.api.fixtures.decisiontables.Input$value(), annotationclass DecisionTableFixture, annotationclass Check, annotationclass Converter, interface TypeConverter
